location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The file is arranged in reverse chronological order.

Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 19; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located at the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence between the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, the Secretary of State for India, the Ministry of Information and the Wireless Telegraphy Board, discussing a proposal to jam Berlin Arabic radio broadcasts in the region of Bahrain, on account of their being listened to in preference to British radio broadcasts.The file also contains correspondence between the High Commissioner, Palestine, and the Secretary of State for the Colonies, regarding the jamming of radio broadcasts in Bagdad [Baghdad], and the jamming and proposed exploitation of radio transmitters in Beirut.The file includes a divider which gives a list of correspondence references contained in the file by year. This is placed at the front of the correspondence.
